input.idea: Telemedicine platform designed for elderly patients (65+) with chronic conditions, featuring large-button UI, family caregiver portal, and integration with NHS patient records to reduce in-person GP visits by 40% for routine check-ups.
input.targetMarket: UK elderly patients (65+) with chronic conditions (diabetes, hypertension, COPD), their family caregivers, and NHS GP practices serving 5,000+ patients
input.problemStatement: Elderly patients struggle with complex telehealth apps and lack family oversight, leading to poor medication adherence and unnecessary emergency room visits costing NHS £400+ per visit
input.solutionHypothesis: Simplified UI + family caregiver notifications + NHS record integration improves medication adherence by 50% and reduces ER visits by 30%

requiredElements: Specific metrics (40% GP visit reduction, 50% adherence improvement, £400 ER cost)
Technical features (large-button UI, caregiver portal, NHS integration)

qualityChecks.specificity: Should mention 65+ age, specific chronic conditions, 40% GP visit reduction, £400 ER cost
qualityChecks.actionability: Describe HOW it works (simplified UI, family portal, NHS record integration)
qualityChecks.avoidGeneric: No 'makes healthcare easier' - must specify elderly-focused design, chronic condition management
